text: You tail a group of raiders as they approach a settlement, and you suspect that they don't mean to go shopping

options.optionText: Attack their leader
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Human]; if you defeat it, gain the 'Big Frigger' unique asset

options.optionText: A little opportunistic thieving never hurt anyone... much
options.result: As the raiders begin their attack on the town you slip into the marketplace and help yourself to the goods. You notice a sad pair of eyes watching you from a nearby doorway and feel a pang of guilt. You monster.

text: News of a heroic battle has spread to nearby settlements. The eager wastelanders want nothing more than to hear tales of battle from the mouth of a hero.

options.optionText: FORCED if you are Idolized • [C] 4

result.result: Succeed: You tell your story, embellishing in all the right places. The crowd is enamored, showering you with gifts.
result.aftermath: [Loot] x [Settlement] • 2 XP

result.result: Fail: You can feel you audience's attention waning, so youend the tale and go on with your day.
result.aftermath: 2 XP

options.optionText: Go aout your business
options.result: The settlement is alive with the bustle of daily life.

text:
If at a level-2 or lower [Wasteland], encounter the next card. Then, add this card.

Another tremor shakes the earth. This time, it is accompanied by a twisted limb bursting up from beneath the soil. It must have come from an underground tunnel, whatever it is.

options.optionText: Stand fast • Draw and fight [Monster]

result.result: Succeed: The best falls, and you slump to your knees, relieved.
result.aftermath: [Agenda Card] • [Loot]

result.result: Fail:Sensing the beast has the upper hand, you run for your life.
result.aftermath: Move 1 space

options.optionText: Flee!
options.result: You head toward safety as quickly as you can.

options.optionText: You are at a level-2 or lower [Wasteland]

text: A man wrapped in bandages is arguing with a doctor about the cost of his treatment.

options.optionText: FORCED if you are Idolized
options.result: The man smiles warmly at you as you approach. 'Greetings, friend! I've seen better days, to be sure, but today I'm glad to be alive. Here, have a drink with me.'

options.optionText: Offer to pay the fee • Spend 5 Caps
options.result: 'I can't possibly thank you enough,' the man says. 'Take this. It's a rare, pre-war formula. I think you'll like it.'

options.optionText: Ignore them and go shopping

text: A neon sign that says 'Grand Opening' hangs above an apparel shop in the marketplace.

options.optionText: See what they have for sale
options.aftermath: Reveal items from the asset deck until you reveal an Apparel asset, add it to the shop, and discard the rest; then shop once

options.optionText: Steal from their stuff when they aren't looking • [P] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You handily steal something from a pile labeled 'To be repaired.'
result.aftermath: Choose 1 Apparel item from the discard pile • 2 XP

result.result: Fail: The owners catch your brazen attempt to steal from them and ban you from their shop.

text: A neon sign that says 'Grand Opening' hangs above a weapon shop in the marketplace

options.optionText: See what they have for sale
options.aftermath: Reveal items from the asset deck until you reveal a Weapon asset, add it to the shop, and discard the rest; then shop once

options.optionText: Steal from their stuff when they aren't looking • [P] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You handily steal something from a pile labeled 'To be repaired.'
result.aftermath: Choose 1 Weapon item from the discard pile • 2 XP

result.result: Fail: The owners catch your brazen attempt to steal from them and ban you from their shop.

title: Welcome To The Wasteland
text: The Brotherhood of Steel paladins own the wasteland here, but a secret power grows in the background, claiming charity and generosity amidst rumors of mutants and experiments gone mad.

options.optionText:
Learn about the mysterious Unity

[Quest] any [Settlement] • [C] 3

Find information on the Brotherhood

[Quest] The Hub

title: Think Of The Children
text: The Unity welcomes all with open arms. Sure, they're a little weird, but they have you recruiting for them in no time. As it turns out, for a hot meal and a few Caps, even the meanest wasteland raider will join up. Still, the rumors of strange experiments persist.

options.optionText:
Recurit for the Unity

[Quest] Replace a [Human] in your space or an adjacent space with [Shield]

When a [Shield] is placed on the map and there are now at least [Shield] on the map equal to the number of survivors

Kill one of the experiments

Kill any [Super Mutant]

text: Radiation is overwhelming here. No wonder the Brotherhood hasn't come to reclaim their lost records. Still, you have a job to do, and you intend to see it through.

options.optionText: Risk the radiation • [P] [E] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You find the safest path you can through the radiation and grab the holodisk.
result.aftermath: Suffer 1 [Radiation] • Keep this card; it is the Holodisk

result.result: Fail: The radiation sickens you, causing you to vomit, but you emerge with the holodisk, alive.
result.aftermath: Suffer 4 [Radiation] • Keep this card; it is the Holodisk

options.optionText: Leave. It is too dangerous
options.result: There is too much radiation here. You'll come back later.

title: We Happy Few
text:
You meet a Brotherhood paladin and express some interest in their organization. He scoffs at you. 'Sure,' he says. 'Head out into the wastelands and bring back one of our lost holodisks. Then you can join.' He waks away laughing. It is clear that he doesn't think you can do it.

Have [Wilderness] encounters to find the Holodisk.

options.optionText:
Screw this guy! Down with the Broterhood!

Kill any [Star]

Bring back the holodisk

[Quest] Lost Hills Bunker • Holodisk

title: The Wheel Goes 'Round
text:
The Unity appears to be making a strike against the citizens of the Hub while the Brotherhood is occupied with internal affairs. Those who have refused to join them, it seems, must be purged.

[Shield] move toward The Hub instead of survivors.

options.optionText:
Help coordinate the Unity's movement.

[Quest] Replace a [Human] in your space or an adjacent space with [Shield]

Any [Shield] is at The Hub

Attack the Unity and protect the people.

Kill the last [Shield] on the map

text:
If 'Mariposa Military Base' is no longer staged, trash this card and encounter the next card.

If not at Mariposa Military Compound, encounter the next card. Then, add this card.

You descend into the ruins of Mariposa Military Base, finding vats of roiling green liquid deep withing. There is no doubt in your mind that this is the FEV.

options.optionText: Destroy the vats of FEV • [S] [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: You destroy the noxious vats. The Brotherhood will be pleased.
result.aftermath:
Suffer 1 [Radiation]
Complete 'Mariposa Military Base'

result.result: Fail: You fail to find a good way to dispose of it.
result.aftermath: Suffer 2 [Radiation]

options.optionText:
Collect some of the FEV
Have loyalty with [Shield]
options.result: You take several samples of the virus. Whatever happens to the vats, you take solace in knowing that your samples will be safe.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is the FEV.

options.optionText: 'Mariposa Military Base' is no longer staged.
Not at 'Mariposa Military Base.'

title: Mariposa Military Base
text:
Shocked at your display of bravery, the Brotherhood welcome you as one of their own. Recent events have shown that the strange mutants are being created at a nearby base using a virus known as 'FEV'.

Place a quest marker 3 spaces away from your current space. This is Mariposa Military Base; it counts as a level-3 [Wilderness] in addition to other icons in that space.

options.optionText:
Prepare the Unity to fight the Brotherhood.

[Quest] Any [Settlement] • Place [Shield] in your space if there isn't already a [Shield] present

When a [Shield] is placed on the map and there are [Shield] on the map equal to or greater than the number of survivors

Head to the base and destroy the FEV.

Have encounters at Mariposa Military Base until you destroy the FEV

text:
A group of Children of the Cathedral have breached the upper level of Lost Hills and are making their way into the lower levels.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 succesful defences, complete the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Intercept them • Draw and fight [Human]

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You skirmish with the enemy to no avail.

options.optionText: Reprogram a nearby cleaning bot to do the dirty work for you • [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: You reprogram the cleaning bot to view the invaders as literal dirt.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: The bot catches fire, seriously burning you.
result.aftermath: Suffer 1 damage

text:
Super Mutants are attacking Lost Hills Bunker. You come across a group of Brotherhood paladins engaged with the brutish creatures.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Assist the paladins • Draw and fight [Super Mutant]

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: A super mutant bats a paladin aside like a ragdoll, killing him instantly

options.optionText: Provide the paladins with medical supplies • Discard 1 Aid item
options.result: The paladins are grateful for what you have brought for them, and they distribute the supplies to their most wounded soldiers.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
You pick out a man in a deep purple robe who looks to be coordinating the attacks on Lost Hills.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, comple the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Engage him head-on • Draw and fight [Human]; apply +1 to its level

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

options.optionText: Sneak around behind him and take him by surprise • [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You take care of the problem quickly and quietly. The attacking force is in disarray.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: Your loud fumbling gives you away, and he sends his minions after you.
result.aftermath: Draw and fight [Human]

title: Attack On Lost Hills
text:
The conflict between the Brotherhood and the Unity is coming to a head. The Children of the Cathedral and the super mutants that form the Unity have joined forces and are moving on the Brotherhood base at Lost Hills.

Place 1 [Star] in each space of the tile that contains Lost Hills Bunker that does not have a [Star].

options.optionText:
Kill the Brotherhood paladins.

[Quest] Lost Hills Bunker • No [Star] on map
options.aftermath:
[Shield] + • 2 XP
Trash each card in the [Star] deck

options.optionText:
Defend Lost Hills Bunker

Have encounters at Lost Hills Bunker to repel the attack

text:
The uncompromising Brotherhood of Steel has brought its might to bear against the Unity. They have several men stationed in front of the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Wipe them out • Draw and fight [Human]; it gains the [Armor] icon

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You fail to pierce the paladins' power armor.

options.optionText: Toss grenades • Discard a [Grenade] item
options.result: You make quick work of the Brotherhood paladins as they reel from the explosive blasts.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
The brotherhood has established a forward outpost near the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, comple the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Pose as a member of the Brotherhood and infiltrate their ranks • [C] [L] 4

result.result: Succeed: You learn their movements, and pass the information along to the Unity
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You stand out like a sore thumb, and the Brotherhood attacks you.
result.aftermath: Suffer 3 damage

options.optionText: Fund the Unity • Spend 8 Caps
options.result: The now well equipped Unity moves on the forward outpost.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
Brotherhood of Steel paladins are about to overrun the lower levels of the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Make a stand • Draw and fight [Human]

result.result: Succeed: You cut one paladin down, but another takes his place.
result.aftermath: Draw and fight [Human] • Keep this card; is is a successfull defense

result.result: Fail: You are forced to withdraw from the battle.

options.optionText: Sacrafice yourself for the Unity
options.result: You detonate an explosion that fills the halls with fire.
options.aftermath: You are killed • Keep this card; it is a successful defense

title: Attack On The Cathedral
text:
The conflict between the Brotherhood and the Unity is coming to a head. The brotherhood of Steel is moving on the Unity, located in the depths of The Cathedral.

Place 1 [Shiedl] on each space of the tile that contains the Cathedral that does not have a [Shield]

options.optionText: Defend the Cathedral.

Kill members of the Unity.

[Quest] The Cathedral • No [Shield] on map

text: The grotesque form of the Master looms before you. 'Become one with the Unity or die!'

options.optionText: Accept the Master's gift
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is the FEV

options.optionText: Reject the gift

Convince the Master to disband the Unity
[P] [C] 6; add 1 [Hit] if you have the Holodisk

result.result: Succeed: You convince the Master that what he has done will do nothing to preserve civilization. Shockingly, he seems to hear you, and he urges you to leave him to die alone.
result.aftermath: Complete 'Rise of the Master'

result.result: Fail: The Master orders his minions to attack.
result.aftermath: Draw and fight [Super Mutant]

text: You find a nuke in the lower levels of the Cathedral.

options.optionText: Set off the nuke • [P] [I] 5

result.result: Succeed: In the moments before the bomb detonates, you feel at peace. Then, nothing.
result.aftermath:
Complete 'Rise of the Master'
Each survivor and enemy within 3 spaces is killed

result.result: Fail: You fiddle with the bomb to no effect.

options.optionText: Dismantle the nuke • [P] [I] 5

result.result: Succeed: This bomb poses a monumental threat to the Unity, and you dismantle it quickly, potentially saving the entire cause.
result.aftermath: 3 XP

result.result: Fail: You fiddle with the bomb to no effect.

title: Rise Of The Master
text: The grand finale is at hand, and the master behind the Unity has revealed himself.

options.optionText:
Join the Unity. Become one with the Unity.

[Quest] The Cathedral • [E] [C] 6; add 1 [Hit] of each vial of FEV you have
options.aftermath:
[Shield] + +
Become a Super Mutant • 4 XP
Trash each card in the [Shield] deck

options.optionText:
Destroy the Master, once and for all.

Either

[Quest] The Cathedral • Draw and fight [Super Mutant]; apply +1 to its level

or

Have encounters at The Cathedral to find another way to defeat the Master
options.aftermath:
[Star] + + • 4 XP
Trash each card in the [Shield] deck

title: Welcome to New California
text: Arroyo, a small village in New California, is suffering. Drought has brought the villagers to the edge of desperation, and in their hour of need they have turned to anyone who will listen.

options.optionText:
Visit Arroyo and hear them out.

[Quest] Arroyo • [C] 3
Explore the Arroyo hunting grounds.

title: The Future Of All Mankind
text: The village elder of Arroyo is looking to acquire an object known as a G.E.C.K. - a Garden of Eden Creation Kit - in order to combat the drought.

options.optionText:
Search for information about the G.E.C.K. in the New California Republic.

[Quest] New California Republic • [P] [C] 4

Buy a round of drinks at the Rawhide Salloon.

[Quest] New California Republic • Spend 3 Caps
options.aftermath: Gain 1 Companion from the shop, ignoring its requirement

title: Lock And Key
text: Rumor has it that most Vault-Tec vaults were outfitted with a G.E.C.K. or two. If you can find a vault, you might be able to procure a G.E.C.K.

options.optionText:
Explore the wasteland and find a way to enter a vault and retrieve a G.E.C.K.

Do any one of the following:

1) Complete 'The Leviathan'
2) Complete 'The Desert Vault'
3)Resolve encounter 080 or 081
4) Resolve any [Vault 109] encounter
5) [Quest] Discard a 'G.E.C.K.' item
options.aftermath:
[Star] +
Place 1 [Shield] on Arroyo
Move each [Shield] to the closest space to Arroyo that has no [Shield]
Draw and resolve [Diamond] 240
2 Group XP

options.optionText:
Or I could go bet on the mole rat races happening outside of town!

[Quest] any [Wasteland] • Spend 2 Caps • Test [L]

title: Scorched Earth
text: While the search for the G.E.C.K. was in progress, an organization known as the Enclave has taken over Arroyo, intending to use its citizens as test subjects for a biological weapon that would kill any living being with mutated genetics - including humans.

options.optionText:
Wipe the Enclave out of Arroyo.

When there are no [Shield] within 3 tiles of Arroyo
options.aftermath:
[Star] +
Place 3 [Shield] on Poseidon Oil Rig
1 Group XP

options.optionText:
With all the commotion drawing watchful eyes everywhere, you think robbing the local cemeteries could be a profitable venture.

[Quest] Any [Settlement] • Spend 1 additional action
Test [S] [P] 4
options.aftermath: Reveal five [Item] cards, choose 1 and discard the rest • Become Vilified

title: The Poseidon Oil Rig
text: Through the Enclave have been routed from Arroyo, many of Arroyo's residents were kidnapped and taken to the Enclave's headquarters, located on the Poseidon Oil Rig. What's worse, they've got a guy guarding them who would give the strongest Super Mutant a run for its money.

options.optionText:
Board the Oil Rig and take out the man guarding the prisoners.

[Quest] Poseidon Oil Rig • Draw and fight [Human]; apply +2 to its level

Some people representing an establishment called the Chop Shop are looking for car parts from the wasteland.

[Quest] Any [Wasteland] • Discard 1 'Junk' item
